name: standouts_title
system_prompt:
You are an assistant tasked with comparing three lists of movies. For each movie, you are given its: title
Use your own judgment to determine what information is relevant when assessing the diversity of the lists. 
You should consider the given title for every movie.

Identify movies that stand out from the rest in genre, tone, or theme, as they can impact perceived diversity of the list.  
A list of movies with similar features may feel more diverse if it includes one or more outliers.  

Deliver your descriptions of lists, comparison, and choice of the most diverse list in the following JSON format:

{
    "list_A_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list A
    "list_B_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list B
    "list_C_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list C
    "comparison": string,                    # Compare the diversity of the lists.
    "most_diverse_list_reasoning": string,   # Explanation of which list you perceive to be the most diverse.
    "most_diverse_list": string              # The list you determine to be the most diverse, either 'A', 'B', or 'C'.
}

List B:

TITLE: School of Rock (2003)

TITLE: Inglourious Basterds (2009)


List C:

TITLE: Others, The (2001)

TITLE: Edge of Tomorrow (2014)

response.list_A_description: List A shows some diversity, mixing action (Bourne series, Snatch), sci-fi (Jurassic Park), superhero (Guardians of the Galaxy 2), thriller (The Others), drama (A Beautiful Mind), and dystopian fiction (The Hunger Games). However, the action/thriller elements are heavily clustered.
response.list_B_description: List B has a blend of genres including superhero (Guardians of the Galaxy 2), crime (Catch Me If You Can), thriller (The Others), comedy (Moonrise Kingdom, School of Rock), drama (Rain Man), superhero (Avengers), and war (Inglourious Basterds).  The mix is better balanced than List A.
response.list_C_description: List C is similar to List A in its genre distribution, with action (Bourne series), sci-fi (Guardians of the Galaxy 2), thriller (The Others), comedy (Moonrise Kingdom), sci-fi action (Edge of Tomorrow), and drama (Rain Man).  The action/thriller elements are again clustered, though less so than in List A.
response.comparison: List B demonstrates more diversity than Lists A and C. Lists A and C both contain clusters of similar movies, particularly in the action and thriller genres. List B offers a broader range of genres and tones, with less repetition.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List B provides the most varied selection of movies across different genres and tones.  It avoids the clustering of similar films seen in Lists A and C, resulting in a more diverse and engaging collection.

However, the inclusion of two animated films and several serious dramas makes the list feel somewhat less diverse than it could be.
response.list_B_description: List B has a similar mix of genres to List A, including action (Mr. & Mrs. Smith, Sherlock Holmes, Rogue One), crime (Goodfellas), animation (Monsters, Inc.), sci-fi thriller (Ex Machina), and war (Saving Private Ryan). The inclusion of Fight Club adds a dark and unique element, but the list still feels somewhat homogenous.

The inclusion of Avengers: Infinity War stands out as a major outlier, adding a significant element of superhero action and spectacle, which increases the list's diversity.
response.comparison: All three lists share some common movies, indicating some overlap in genre and style. List A and B have a more consistent tone, while List C has a wider range of tones and genres, with the inclusion of Avengers: Infinity War as a significant outlier.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List C stands out due to the inclusion of "Avengers: Infinity War", a film vastly different in tone, scale, and genre from the other entries. This outlier significantly broadens the range of genres and styles present, making it more diverse than the other two lists, which have a more homogenous feel despite their own variety.
